entry.title: Can't help but wonder where I'm bound
entry.summary:
Author: thehyacinthgirl

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,020Chapters: 1/12Kudos: 3

Summary: When Vault 76 opens, Stiles Stilinski steps into a world gone to hell. Radiation-scorched forests, mutated beasts, and no Wi-Fi. Armed with sarcasm, a baseball bat, and way too much curiosity, he sets out to find the Overseer, with a purpose to find an answer for the darkness he left behind and ends up stumbling into a far older mystery buried in the Appalachian wilds.Derek Hale has survived the apocalypse the same way he’s survived everything else: teeth bared, walls high, and trust in no one. But when a loudmouthed Vault Dweller starts poking around werewolf territory—and then refuses to leave—Derek is forced to make a choice: protect his family or protect the boy who won’t stop looking at him like he’s something more than a monster but is holding back something from him.As the Scorched Plague spreads and enemies close in from all sides, Stiles and Derek will have to decide whether to risk everything for the fragile hope of survival… and the unexpected promise of something even rarer in a broken world: love.

entry.title: Copain of the black wolf.
entry.summary:
Author: EverythingRara

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 158,110Chapters: 18/40Kudos: 321

Summary: A Sterek rewrite of the show, that stays mostly canon compliant in the beginning, shown exclusively through the eyes of Stiles Stilinski, unknown soul mate of Derek Hale.Starts slow emotionally, my first attempt at a story of this degree please be gentle.Stiles grunted softly as he heaved himself onto the roof, his sneakers scuffing against the shingles. Scott—his best friend since forever—wasn’t answering his phone, and Stiles couldn’t wait. There was no way Scott was going to believe what Stiles had just overheard.Keeping low, Stiles crept along the roof toward Scott’s window, his heart racing as the cool night air pressed against his skin. He tried the window, but it wouldn’t budge—it was locked.“Of course it’s locked,” he muttered under his breath, rolling his eyes.Knocking softly on the glass, he leaned in closer, squinting to peer inside. The curtains were drawn, giving him only a hazy, distorted view of the room beyond. “Scott,” he hissed, rapping on the window again. No answer.Suddenly, the curtains shifted, and the window flung open. Scott and Stiles screamed, startling each other.

entry.title: my blood never tasted like wine
entry.summary:
Author: Melpomene (Aconitehart)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,062Chapters: 2/10Kudos: 121

Summary: Peter looks up and frowns. "I'm busy, nephew."Shit. Stiles peeks over his shoulder and, sure enough, there's Derek Hale. Dark hair, pale eyes, stubble carefully sculpted and contoured. He looks older now, more solid, with a hint of grey at his temples.  He's wearing a suit, like every other mobster werewolf in existence. Stiles stares, open-mouthed, for a moment before he realises that Derek is glaring at him. Mortified, he turns away, his heart banging against his rib cage."Ah, that's right," Peter says, lazily waving a hand. "You two are already acquainted."That's not really how Stiles would put it, but he keeps his mouth shut. He stares down at his hands, feeling Derek's gaze boring holes through him."The Stilinski kid is here looking for work?" Derek asks, sounding almost disgusted. "He's going to be dancing here?""I feel like a broken record," Stiles snaps, twisting around to look at Derek again. "For the last time, all of my clothes are staying on. I'm not going to writhe around a stripper pole to entertain a bunch of wolves. But I can mix drinks and serve cocktails, okay? That's what I want to do."

It's all he sees as Stiles says, “You know. I think I was wrong on both accounts." Before Derek can respond, Stiles continues, “Will you ask again? Properly.” Stiles glances to the side of the table. entry.title: Frozen Lines
entry.summary:
Author: am0ra

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 54,702Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 38

Summary: The ice was his sanctuary. His home.But outside the rink, everything was war.Stiles carried a past full of pain—silent wounds no one could see. And Derek, the unyielding captain of the basketball team, was the last person he wanted to face.Enemies bound by pride, secrets, and unspoken grudges.In a town where trust shatters like thin ice, their collision is inevitable.Can two broken souls break down the walls between them? Or will the fight destroy everything, including what they never expected to find: each other?The ice will always be his sanctuary. But maybe, for the first time, the battle is worth fighting off the rink.

entry.title: Lay My Curses Out to Rest
entry.summary:
Author: sponfawn

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 61,297Chapters: 14/14Kudos: 77

Summary: "Are you there, God? It's me, Stiles. Look, I know I never really went to Mass or anything like a good Polish kid but could you do me a big one and have this whole thing be entirely Not related to the supernatural - hell, it could be super cartel related but no shapeshifters, or chaos spirits, or fear monsters, or deranged Hunters, or fucking human sacrifices of any kind. Just do this for once and I'll do whatever. Well, not whatever, but I dunno I'll be a good son. You like that “honor thy father” stuff, right? I'll honor the fuck out of my dad, even come to visit more often! Confucius will weep at the intensity of my filial piety. Deal? Just. PLEASE."It's 2027 - a decade since Stiles was last in Beacon Hills - and the FBI has sent Stiles back to investigate a smuggling case.ORIn which I attempt to write the kind of story I want to read. A future Sterek fic that: 1) is in character, 2) doesn't bash any characters, 3) fixes Davis' timeline, 4) doesn't have sex, 5) has some character interactions that don't just revolve around Sterek/Stiles/Derek, and 6) addresses Derek and Stiles' unique traumas.
